quoteLast: that eventful day a pretty strong intimation of what was about to take place; while Lee's dispatch to Grant agreeing to surrender on Grant's terms did not reach him until half past eleven o'clock A.M., the latter being considerably in the rear of his forces, passing from the right to the left to communicate with Sheridan.
title:
History of the Twelfth West Virginia Volunteer Infantry
The Part It Took in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1865
author: Hewitt, William, active 19th century

quoteLast: , two small pocket-pistols, three inches long in the barrel. These he gets Mr. Gilmore to load, but purchases no further ammunition.

quoteFirst: Medical men advise the very delicate to wait till the sun has driven away the cold and moisture of the dawn before they venture out, and to return from their morning walks or drives in time to avoid the effects of the direct rays, which are most powerful
quoteLast: But in regulating hours regard must of course be had to previous modes of life, and the obstinate early riser of the plains should gradually, not suddenly, alter his Indian for English habits. The diet of valetudinarians on the first ascent ought in a great degree to be regulated by circumstances depending on the nature of each individual’s complaint.
title: Goa and the Blue Mountains; or, Six months of sick leave
author: Burton, Richard Francis, Sir, 1821-1890

quoteFirst: The weather was pleasant, the sun shining brightly, with a choppy sea. The ships were about 500 miles from the coast of France and had passed through what was considered to be the most dangerous part of the war zone. At
quoteLast: a terrific explosion occurred on the port side of the ship about 120 feet from the bow and immediately afterwards another explosion occurred on the port side about 120 feet from the stern of the ship, these explosions being immediately identified as coming from torpedoes fired by a German submarine.
title:
World's War Events $v Volume 3

quoteFirst: The philosopher, without lifting up his eyes to view the person in whose behalf he was consulted, turned his ear to one of the sable familiars that purred upon his shoulder, and, taking up the pen, wrote upon a detached slip of paper these words, which Peregrine, at the desire of the ladies, repeated aloud: “Her destiny will, in a great measure, depend upon what happened to her
quoteTime: about nine o'clock in the morning
quoteLast: on the third day of last December.”
title: The Adventures of Peregrine Pickle
author: Smollett, T. (Tobias), 1721-1771

quoteFirst: We stopped about six miles from town and rested our horses. At about daylight we again started, arriving at Johnson's island

quoteFirst: The construction of the trench was not without its effect upon the gang of villains at Morris's.

quoteFirst: Hurrying through the town, the 3rd Brigade reached the Homs road, and pressed along it on the track of the enemy force that had escaped that way the previous evening. The 10th Regiment came up with part of this force
quoteTime: about nine o'clock in the morning
quoteLast: , on the Wadi Maraba, near Harista el Basal, and promptly charged it, killing many with the sword, and capturing about 600 prisoners and some forty machine guns. Continuing the pursuit, the cavalry came upon more of the enemy near Duma, and again at Khan Kusseir, twelve miles from Damascus, in the evening.
title:
The Desert Mounted Corps
An Account of the Cavalry Operations in Palestine and Syria 1917-1918

quoteFirst: We had expected to leave New York
quoteTime: about nine o’clock in the morning
quoteLast: , but at eleven we were still making selections of what we most needed to take with us, and finally choosing the wrong things with an accuracy that amounted to a talent. quoteFirst: There were no questions asked me while on board the boat. The boat landed
quoteLast: in Cincinnati, and I waited until after most of the passengers had gone off of the boat; I then walked as gracefully up street as if I was not running away, until I had got pretty well up Broadway. My object was to go to Canada, but having no knowledge of the road, it was necessary for me to make some inquiry before I left the city.

quoteFirst: Here, without rations, the bare stone floor for a bed, the dampness trickling down the walls on either side, seven of us were confined in a close room about seven feet by nine. quoteLast: of Tuesday, the second day of the shipwreck, the approach in the little whale-boat was descried by those on the rock; all uttered an exclamation of joy, and in return the surprise of the coxswain and his crew to find so many of their shipmates still surviving is not to be described.
title:
Thrilling Narratives of Mutiny, Murder and Piracy
A weird series of tales of shipwreck and disaster, from the earliest part of the century to the present time, with accounts of providential escapes and heart-rending fatalities.
